intro: Lepidium bourgeauanum, commonly known as the Bourgeau's cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Lepidium bourgeauanum is generally found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in full sun.
